column4: ok, thanks lupine_85, so it seems Ubuntu isn't really a bleeding edge distro :)
yeah
to me bleeding edge means the latest stable release of a program
well, ok I like close to bleeding edge then :)
stable edge
I tried Frugalware, but got a bit dissappointed
now I'm attracted by Ubuntu again
for the sheer polish of it :)
What would you guys say about Ubuntu performance compared to other distros (in terms of speed)?
finally, I think it's ok
problem with many distrib is that they install a ton of unneeded crap by default
yeah
so boot is slow if you do a normal install
one thing about Arch I've been liking is speed
it booted faster than any distro
but maybe upstart will increase bootup speed for Ubuntu
though, last install I did, I set it up more like arch, only installing base system, and it's much better ;)
cool :)
it doesn't atm
and the ui is comparable in term of speed. maybe ubuntu gnome is a bit more bloated, but it's quite neat
and you can still use any wm you want
indeed
